techs.name: Before Steam
techs.quote: 'Where tillage begins, other arts follow. The farmers therefore are the founders of human civilization.' - Daniel Webster
uniques: Enables embarked units to enter ocean tiles
Enables conversion of city production to gold
Enables conversion of city production to science

techs.name: Steam Power
techs.quote: 'The nations of the West hope that by means of steam communication all the world will become as one family.' - Townsend Harris

techs.name: Analog Computation
techs.quote: 'There will always be plenty of things to compute in the detailed affairs of millions of people doing complicated things.' â€“ Vannevar Bush

techs.name: Economic Imperialism
techs.quote: 'Avarice, the spur of industry.' - David Hume

techs.name: Propulsion
techs.quote: 'To invent an airplane is nothing. To build an airplane is something. But to fly... is everything.' - Ferdinand Ferber

techs.name: Eruptives
techs.quote: 'Nature, to be commanded, must be obeyed.' - Francis Bacon

techs.name: Vertical Integration
techs.quote: 'Competition is a sin.' - John D. Rockefeller

techs.name: Expedition
techs.quote: 'In wilderness I sense the miracle of life, and behind it our scientific accomplishments fade to trivia.' - Charles Lindbergh

techs.name: Landships
techs.quote: 'The defenders had been driven right and left as soon as the prow of this land Ironclad had loomed up over the front of the trench.' - H.G Wells

techs.name: Noblesse Oblige
techs.quote: 'Virtue is the truest nobility.' - Miguel de Cervantes

techs.name: Airships
techs.quote: 'Aeronautics was neither an industry nor a science. It was a miracle.' - Igor Sikorsky

techs.name: Infernal Combustion
techs.quote: 'The most tangible of all visible mysteries - fire.' - James Henry Leigh Hunt

techs.name: Gospel of Wealth
techs.quote: 'I resolved to stop accumulating and begin the Infinitely more serious and difficult task of wise distribution' - Andrew Carnegie

techs.name: Galvanomagnetism
techs.quote: 'Is it a fact - or have I dreamt it - that, by means of electricity, the world of matter has become a great nerve, vibrating thousands of miles in a breathless point of time?' - Nathaniel Hawthorne

techs.name: Automata
techs.quote: 'Civilization advances by extending the number of important operations which we can perform without thinking about them.' - Alfred North Whitehead

techs.name: Uranography
techs.quote: 'I fly because it releases my mind from the tyranny of petty things.' - Antoine de Saint Exupery

techs.name: Military Science
techs.quote: 'Speak softly and carry a big stick; you will go far.' - Theodore Roosevelt

techs.name: Civil Defense
techs.quote: 'Defense is superior to opulence.' - Adam Smith

techs.name: Radio
techs.quote: 'The whole country was tied together by radio. We all experienced the same heroes and comedians and singers. They were giants.' - Woody Allen

techs.name: Robotics
techs.quote: '1. A robot may not injure a human being or, through inaction, allow a human being to come to harm. 2. A robot must obey any orders given to it by human beings, except when such orders would conflict with the First Law. 3. A robot must protect its own existence as long as such protection does not conflict with the First or Second Law.' - Isaac Asimov

techs.name: Air Superiority
techs.quote: 'Any sufficiently advanced technology is indistinguishable from magic.' - Arthur C. Clarke

techs.name: Subterranean Exploration
techs.quote: 'One just principle from the depths of a cave is more powerful than an army.' - Jose Marti

techs.name: Technocracy
techs.quote: 'A government of reason is better than one of force.' - Thomas Jefferson

techs.name: Perpetual Motion
techs.quote: 'Give me a place to stand and a lever long enough, and I shall move the world.' - Archimedes

techs.name: The Grand Idea
techs.quote: 'Men love to wonder, and that is the seed of our science.' - Ralph Waldo Emerson
